archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Ghost Pepper Steak Lettuce Wraps with Mango-Lime Salsa
description: Sear spiced sirloin, then pile it into crisp lettuce cups with a fiery mango-lime salsa for a Caribbean-Mexican heat blast. Simple, fast, and built for chili lovers.
prep_steps: Rinse and dry 1 head of lettuce; separate large leaves for cups.
Peel and dice 1 mango into small cubes.
Finely dice 1 small red onion (about 1/2 cup).
Chop 1/2 cup coriander (leaves and tender stems).
Finely mince 1 jalapenos and 1 small ghost chilli (use gloves).
Zest and juice 2 limes into a small bowl.
Pat dry 600 g sirloin steak; trim excess fat.
In a small bowl, mix 1 tsp ground cumin, 1/2 tsp allspice, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, and half the minced ghost chilli.
cook_steps: Preheat a heavy pan on the stovetop (or outdoor grill) over high heat for 2–3 minutes.
Rub steak with 1 tbsp olive oil; coat all sides with the spice-chilli mix.
Sear steak 3–4 minutes per side for medium-rare (thicker pieces may need 1–2 minutes more). Rest on a board 5 minutes.
While steak rests, make salsa: In a bowl, combine mango, red onion, jalapenos, remaining ghost chilli, half the coriander, half the lime juice, and 1 tsp olive oil. Season with a pinch of salt; toss.
Make a quick lime-garlic drizzle: Stir remaining lime juice, lime zest, minced garlic, and 1 tsp olive oil. Season with a pinch of salt.
Slice rested steak thinly against the grain.
Assemble: Layer lettuce leaves on a platter. Add steak slices, spoon mango salsa on top, drizzle with lime-garlic sauce, and finish with remaining coriander.
Serve immediately and let everyone build extra-hot wraps.
